intro: Solena macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered solena, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Solena macrantha is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
